#include <stdio.h>

#include <stdlib.h>

#include <string.h>

int compare(const void *a, const void *b) {

    return *(int*)a - *(int*)b;

}

int main() {

    int n;

    scanf("%d", &n);

    int first_output;

    bool early_exit = false;

    if (n ==1) {

        int val;

        scanf("%d", &val);

        first_output = val;

    } else {

        int *a = malloc(n * sizeof(int));

        for (int i=0; i <n; i++) {

            scanf("%d", &a[i]);

        }

        qsort(a, n, sizeof(int), compare);

        if (a[n-1] ==0) {

            first_output =0;

        } else {

            int current_size = n;

            while (current_size >1) {

                // Step 1: Remove zeros.

                int new_size =0;

                for (int i=0; i < current_size; i++) {

                    if (a[i] !=0) {

                        a[new_size++] = a[i];

                    }

                }

                current_size = new_size;

                if (current_size ==0) {

                    break;

                }

                // Step 2: Find min (a[0] since sorted).

                int min = a[0];

                // Step 3: Process each element.

                bool found_one = false;

                for (int i=0; i < current_size; i++) {

                    int val = a[i] % min;

                    if (val ==1) {

                        first_output =1;

                        early_exit = true;

                        goto end_processing;

                    }

                    a[i] = val;

                }

                // Step 4: Sort again.

                qsort(a, current_size, sizeof(int), compare);

                // Step 5: Check size.

                if (current_size ==1) {

                    first_output = a[0];

                    break;

                }

            }

        }

        end_processing:

        free(a);

    }

    if (early_exit) {

        printf("1\n");

    } else {

        int second_output = (first_output ==1) ? 0 :1;

        char output_str[2];

        sprintf(output_str, "%d", second_output);

        // Process third step (though redundant, but to be precise):

        int uppercase =0, lowercase =0;

        for (int i=0; i < strlen(output_str); i++) {

            char ch = output_str[i];

            if (ch >= 'A' && ch <= 'Z') {

                uppercase++;

            } else {

                lowercase++;

            }

        }

        if (uppercase > lowercase) {

            for (int i=0; i < strlen(output_str); i++) {

                output_str[i] = toupper(output_str[i]);

            }

        } else {

            for (int i=0; i < strlen(output_str); i++) {

                output_str[i] = tolower(output_str[i]);

            }

        }

        printf("%s\n", output_str);

    }

    return 0;

}
